contextId.occurrenceNote: Possible meanings are 1) that the word "death" is repeated for emphasis and the phrase means "an aroma that causes death" or 2) "an aroma of death that causes people to die" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-doublet]])
contextId.glQuote: an aroma from death to death

contextId.occurrenceNote: Possible meanings are 1) that the word "life" is repeated for emphasis and the phrase means "an aroma that gives life" or 2) "an aroma of life that gives people live" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-doublet]])
Here "fear" and "trembling" share similar meanings and emphasize the intensity of fear. Alternate translation: "you welcomed him with great reverence" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-doublet]])
contextId.quote: μετὰ φόβου καὶ τρόμου ἐδέξασθε αὐτόν
contextId.glQuote: you welcomed him with fear and trembling

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here the words "good" and "acceptable" share similar meanings and emphasize the goodness of the thing. Alternate translation: "a very good thing" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-doublet]])
